content.title: West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024: Assistance to Viable and Potentially Viable PWCS
content.department: Micro, Small & Medium Enterprise and Textiles Department
content.details: Assistance to Viable and Potentially Viable PWCS is a sub-scheme under the West Bengal Handloom and Khadi Weavers Financial Benefit Scheme 2024, by the MSME and Textiles Dept, Government of West Bengal aims to provide financial assistance to the PWCS and Khadi Societies who will fulfill the criteria of viability.
benefits: One time financial assistance ranging between ₹1,00,000/- and ₹10,00,000/- depending on the extent of activity.
eligibility: Registered Primary Weavers’ Cooperative Societies under the West Bengal Cooperative Societies Act.
Khadi Societies fulfilling the criteria of viability.
exclusions: Claims will be revoked in case of misrepresentation of facts or furnishing false information.
content.application_process: Eligible PWCs/Khadi society/Individual Weaver will apply either online or offline in the prescribed format before the Director, Textiles.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'PWCS'?
faqs.answer: 'PWCS' means the Primary Weavers’ Cooperative Societies registered under the West Bengal Cooperative Societies Act.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'Viable'?
faqs.answer: 'Viable' means the PWCS and Khadi Societies who will fulfill the criteria of viability as may be determined by the state level committee established under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the extent of financial support provided by the State Government under this sub-scheme?
faqs.answer: PWCS shall get one time financial assistance ranging between ₹1,00,000/- and ₹10,00,000/- depending on the extent of activity.

faqs.question: What process will be followed by the department for the administration of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Committee will scrutinize and examine the claim proposals as would be submitted in the prescribed format and will cause Field Enquiry, if necessary.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of any misrepresentation of facts or furnishing false information by an applicant, all his/ her claims under the scheme shall be revoked.

faqs.question: Will similar benefits under existing schemes continue alongside this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, an eligible PWC/Khadi Society etc. which has availed of incentive/subsidy under any other scheme prior to the introduction of this scheme shall be eligible to get the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is an eligible PWC/Khadi Society that has already received an incentive or subsidy under a different scheme still eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, an eligible PWC/Khadi Society etc. which has availed of incentive/subsidy under any other scheme prior to the introduction of this scheme shall be eligible to get the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: How will the Grievance Redressal Mechanism operate for this scheme?
faqs.answer: In case of any grievances against the decision of the Directorate of Textiles, application is to be made to the Principal Secretary, Department of MSME&T, Government of West Bengal.

faqs.question: What is the date of commencement and duration of this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 7th March, 2024 and will remain in force for five years.

faqs.question: How can the benefits be availed?
faqs.answer: An eligible PWCs/ Khadi society/ Individual Weaver will apply either in online or in offline mode in the prescribed format before the Director, Textiles.

faqs.question: What is the frequency of the assistance?
faqs.answer: The assistance will be provided one time to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'Societies'?
faqs.answer: 'Societies' means and includes PWCS, Handloom Clusters, JLG groups, Handloom Groups.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'Khadi Society'?
faqs.answer: 'Khadi Society' means Society Registered under Co-operative Societies Act / Official Trustees Act / Societies Act/ Partnership Firm/ Company's Act etc who are involved/ engaged in handloom/ khadi related activities.
